data.name: What is a Matrix? (& Transposes)
data.description: A matrix is essentially a container of scalar numbers.

data.name: Matrix Multiplication
data.description: Calculate the product of two matrices

data.name: Inversion & Singular Matrices
data.description: Inversion is the process of find the matrix that multiplies a matrix to produce the identity matrix. Singular matrices are non-invertible.

data.name: Linear Equations (Ax=b)
data.description: Using linear algebra to solve linear equations

data.name: Vector Spaces & Basis
data.description: A vector space is a set of vectors in which any scalar multiplication can occur and the result remains in the space

data.name: Random Variables
data.description: Variables whose possible values are numerical outcomes of a random phenomenon

data.name: Probability Axioms
data.description: The fundamental rules of probability theory

data.name: Expectations
data.description: What you would expect the value of a set of trials to be on average

data.name: Conditional Probability & Independence
data.description: The rules around probabilities that depend or do not depend on each other

data.name: Variance
data.description: Variance is a measure of the spread of data from their mean value

data.name: Bayes' Theorem
data.description: Bayes' theorem describes the probability of an event, based on prior knowledge of conditions that might be related to the event.

data.name: Differentiation
data.description: Differentation is the process of finding the differential of a function, which is a function describing the sensitivity to change of it's argument

data.name: Product Rule
data.description: A method for finding the derivatives of the products of two or more functions

data.name: Chain Rule
data.description: The chain rule provides a method of finding the derivative of composite functions. Knowing the change in z relative y and change in y relative to x lets us find the rate of change of z relative to x.

data.name: Integration
data.description: Methods for finding the area under a curve of a function

data.name: Cost functions
data.description: Measures of how wrong a model is in estimating the relationship between it's inputs and the desired output

data.name: Intro to Optimisation
data.description: The process of maximising or minimizing a function by systematically choosing input values

data.name: Ax=b Least Squares
data.description: A method for estimating unknown parameters based on mimizing the squared distance between datapoints and a regression line

data.name: Linear Regression
data.lectures: Linear Algebra course 14-24,      Machine Learning week 1-2
data.description: A linear approach to esitimating the relationship between an depedent and independent variables

data.name: Central Limit Theorem
data.description: In populations with a mean and standard deviation, if you take a sufficient number of samples, the means of those samples will be normally distributed

data.name: Gaussian Distribution
data.description: A continuous probability distribution to approximate random variables. Also known as the 'normal distribution' or informally as the 'bell curve'

data.name: Covariance
data.description: A measure of the strength of correlation between two or more random variables

data.name: Symmetric Matrices
data.description: A square matrix that is equal to it's transpose. In other words, it's symmetric around the main diagonal of the matrix

data.name: Positive Definite Matrices
data.description: Symmetric matrices with positive eigenvalues

data.name: Markov Matrices
data.description: A Markov matrix is a square matrix with all nonnegative entries, and where the sum of the entries down any column is 1
